intro: Laseguea erecta var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed laseguea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit and smooth, glabrous stems. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and may have a slightly hairy underside. The flowers are usually small and clustered, producing a subtle fragrance that attracts pollinators.
